instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message:
MacBook came in with quarter fanspin, turns out one of the legs of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> was ripped off the board. ran a jumper from the chip to the board and it is now booting
When booting about 1/3 of the progress bar the screen will flicker and will continue to startup normally, but if it doesn't flicker when it gets there it will just sit on the loading bar at 1/3

In ASD OS "IC0R" fails looked at <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> area looks perfect.
It's acting really strange symptoms are like the usual <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> job. But have reflowed and soldered that twice now. Sometimes it will freeze up when using it and this is the log I get, CPU panic?




Anonymous UUID:       F506F786-C880-55BA-B422-118908AADD2C

Fri Aug 18 12:47:47 2017

*** Panic Report ***
panic(cpu 4 caller 0xffffff802b605ecd): Kernel trap at 0xffffff7fadde3fd4, type 14=page fault, registers:
CR0: 0x000000008001003b, CR2: 0xffffff8135b35e58, CR3: 0x000000001ec6d00a, CR4: 0x00000000001626e0
RAX: 0xffffff7fade2c9c8, RBX: 0xffffff8042f2c800, RCX: 0xffffff8135b35e00, RDX: 0x0000000000000107
RSP: 0xffffff913a0636f0, RBP: 0xffffff913a0636f0, RSI: 0x0000000000000002, RDI: 0xffffff8042f2c800
R8:  0xffffff913a0633b8, R9:  0xffffff913a0633b0, R10: 0x0000000000000000, R11: 0x0000000000000000
R12: 0x000000000000002f, R13: 0xffffff80fe1a1000, R14: 0x0000000000000000, R15: 0x0000000000000004
RFL: 0x0000000000010286, RIP: 0xffffff7fadde3fd4, CS:  0x0000000000000008, SS:  0x0000000000000010
Fault CR2: 0xffffff8135b35e58, Error code: 0x0000000000000000, Fault CPU: 0x4, PL: 0, VF: 1

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message:
Just noticed when i do get it to startup it will continue working but 30 seconds or so after plugging the charger in it will stop working, ie. cursor is spinning wheel and cant click on things, but cursor still moves


ASD EFI passes no problems, IC0R reads 0.6

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message: Beeing That <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> leg is ripped of That dont magicly happen. Prefucked iT is. Check rest of the board again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message: Yeah I've gone over the board several times haven't found anything out of the ordinary

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message:
took off heatsink and found a boatload of thermal paste, it was everywhere covering all the resistors and all. Hoped cleaning it off would fix it but no difference.
Swapped out <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> still no difference. It seems the problem occurs when it tries to use the nvidia gpu

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message: Did they fuck with the GPU? I bet this is a fucked up reflow or something. Are the black plastic coverings on the CPU/GPU in tact?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu panic?
threads.message: Gpu cover looks untouched, seems to have fixed itself for now
